subject: Management
title: Culture Is What You Do
description: A quick win: understand Culture Is What You Do.

hook.text: A company's wall said 'People First.' They laid off 500 workers by email on a Friday night.

buildup.text: Culture isn't what you write on the wall. It's what happens when no one is watching.

discovery.text: Edgar Schein: culture is the shared assumptions that guide behavior, not the stated values.

twist.text: Most companies have two cultures: the one they advertise and the one employees actually experience.

climax.text: Look at what gets rewarded, tolerated, and punished. That's your real culture.

punchline.text: Culture is behavior, not a poster on the wall.

quiz.question: What truly defines an organization's culture?
options: The actual behaviors that are rewarded, tolerated, and punished
The values and mission printed on the company website
The CEO's personal vision for the organization
